page.title: 17Community Relations
page.content: With perhaps one exception there is a strong community feeling. It is 'a friendly place to live' with 'good neighbours who can be relied on in a crisis'. The sense of community is built around the churches, pubs & schools & is fostered by the 2 parish magazines. These are widely read & are the main vehicles for keeping in touch with what is going on. The exception is the ambivalent feeling towards one of the 2 council estates in Walkern where the E Herts Council have brought in 'outsiders'. As in most villages there are contributers & non contrib- uters & a high gossip level but there is also a high tolerance level for non conforming behaviour. Newcomers find that it takes time to become accepted (at least 10 yrs) but are generally made welcome if an effort is made to become involved in the community.
